Overview.Summary: The 2020 Greek presidential election (9) saw the election of Ekaterini Sakellaropoulou as the first female president of the Hellenic Republic (1,2,9,10). She will be sworn in on March 13, 2020 (3,9). The election marked a return to normalcy (4) after the 2019 parliamentary election (4). Similar to the 1982 Irish general election, there is a possibility of two elections being held in one year in Greece (6). In the United States, primaries and caucuses are used to determine presidential candidates (7). Taiwan also held a presidential election in 2020 (8).

Overview.Summary: In the 2020 Greek presidential election, Katerina Sakellaropoulou was elected as the first female president with a large majority (1, 7, 9). The election was held on January 22 and she will take office in March (1, 7, 9). This election was one of many happening globally in 2020, including the United States, Taiwan, and Afghanistan (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 10). In the United States, there is high polarization and stress surrounding the election (6, 8).

Overview.Summary: On January 22, 2020, Katerina Sakellaropoulou was elected as Greece's first female president by parliament (1,3,6,10). This marked a significant milestone for the country (5). Sakellaropoulou is a high court judge and human rights advocate (3,6). The new president was formally sworn in on March 13, 2020 (2,7,8). Greece's previous president Prokopis Pavlopoulos' five-year term expired in 2020 (5). The 2019 parliamentary election served as a decompression valve for the electorate to punish the incumbent government (4).

Timeline.Text: Greece prepares for a new president as the five-year term of the current president Prokopis Pavlopoulos expires in 2020.
High court judge Katerina Sakellaropoulou is elected as Greece's first female president by parliament.
Katerina Sakellaropoulou is officially sworn in as Greece's first female president.
Katerina Sakellaropoulou is the first female president of Greece.
Katerina Sakellaropoulou is formally sworn in as Greece's first female president.
Katerina Sakellaropoulou takes her oath of office in parliament, with only representatives present due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Overview.Summary: Katerina Sakellaropoulou was elected as the first female President of Greece in January 2020, with an overwhelming majority vote in Parliament (2,3,8,12,14,15,17,18,20). She was sworn in on March 13, 2020, and will serve a five-year term (1,7,14). The Greek presidential office is honorary and does not have the power to dissolve Parliament (1). This election marks a historic moment for Greece as it is the first time a woman has been elected as President (2,3,7,8,17,18).

Timeline.Text: Katerina Sakellaropoulou is elected as Greece's first female president by an overwhelming majority in parliament.
The official website of the European Parliament shares a news article about the first woman to be elected as President of the Hellenic Republic.
Ashraf Ghani is declared the winner of the Afghan presidential election, but his opponent rejects the result.
Togolese citizens elect their president for the next five years.
Vermont holds its primary elections for the Democratic and Republican parties.
Greek President Katerina Sakellaropoulou is sworn into office in Parliament.
Greece's first female president is formally sworn into office.
The 2019 Greek parliamentary election marks the country's official exit from its bailout program.
An indirect election is held for the 26th Seanad in Ireland.
